entry.title: Combined summary - [PATCH] Add spellcheck tool (requires `aspell`), also spellcheck.
entry.summary: The passage delves into the topic of patches applied to Basis of Lightning Technology (BOLT) in the Lightning Network. These patches standardize pluralization for 'HTLC', explain channel reserve and the use of 'push-msat', describe how retransmission of any channel messages works, outline the unique set of keys used in each commitment transaction, and discuss the structure of an onion packet used in onion routing. The post also discusses the process of forwarding a hashed time-locked contract (HTLC) packet through multiple nodes in the Lightning Network and provides examples of error packets that can occur during this process. The handling of on-chain HTLC output is also discussed, as well as the ways a channel can end: cooperation, force-close, and breach. Furthermore, the post mentions the official Noise protocol name for Lightning Network's variant. Lastly, it includes a script called spellcheck.sh that can be used to spellcheck files using Aspell, with the homedir being in the tools/ directory of the repository.In a related context, ZmnSCPxj shared a patch on Github for lightning-rfc, but Rusty informed that the patch was line-wrapped, whitespace-mangled, and not applicable. Rusty fixed the errors and worked through spelling mistakes before adding a Travis check against introducing new ones. The fixed patch is available on Github, and ZmnSCPxj apologized for the trouble caused by the original patch and thanked Rusty for fixing and improving it.
